page.title: 19FARMING
page.content: When you go North towards the Firth of Forth the soil becomes very light and sandy,but when you go South the ground rises and the soil gets heavier.Even further south the ground rises again and the soil becomes heavier still. On the sandy ground the farmers have to irrigate the soil very often because the soil drains very easily.A lot of potatoes are grown in sandy areas because the ground is softer and lighter.Arable farmers grow barley, wheat, turnips, oilseed rape and ordinary rape. At the foot of the Lammermuir Hills nearly all the farms there are sheep farms because the land is to steep for tractors to get up and down and the farmers do not need to spend money to buy fences
